<<<api>>>: DataOutputStream.write
<<<code>>>: BufferedReader reader = new BufferedReader(new FileReader("input.txt"));
DataOutputStream dos = new DataOutputStream(new FileOutputStream("output.txt"));
String line;
while ((line = reader.readLine()) != null) {
    dos.writeBytes(line);
    dos.writeByte('\n');
}
reader.close();
dos.close();
<<<explanation>>>: This code reads the file line by line using BufferedReader's readLine() method, which does not include the line termination characters. Then it writes each line to the output file using DataOutputStream's writeBytes() method, followed by writing a LF character. This way, regardless of the original line termination characters in the input file, the output file will always use LF as the end of line character.
